post.body: I tried very hard to be angry about my human's disappearance behind the Big Door for so long, but found it more convenient to be petted.
Busy catching up on my rest after 5 days of vigilant monitoring of the comings and goings of the Pet Sitter. My human is finally home. Grr.
Moping. My human has her luggage out. The "Pet Sitter" tried to sweet talk me, but I am on to her. I am protesting from under the couch.
My human received a box from behind the Big Door. After she unpacked it, I thoroughly investigated it for vermin. Sadly, none was found.
Have business to conduct in the Realm (the conduit is through a portal under the couch) today. My human thinks I sleep under there. Ha!
Let my human hold me like a baby--for about 10 seconds. Then, I squirmed away. I may be neutered, but I have my pride.
Got a pedicure last night. Very unsatisfactory activity. Tried to bite my human to show her that I do not want to participate in such things
Napped with my human today under the lavender blanket. Very cozy. It was unfortunately cut short by my human's short attention span.
Spent time in the Realm today. That is what my humans call the area beneath the couch. But do they know about the Portal under there?
Another day marred by the absence of my human. I have a severe case of attention-deprivation. I will work harder on my Puss 'n Boot eyes.
Been following my human around trying to coach her on being more responsive to my needs. She's a slow learner. I'm trying to be patient.
Rats! I'm a prisoner in the back bedroom. There are people shooting a video in the backyard and I'm not allowed out. Rassin' furrassin'...
Waited for hours for my human to return from behind the big door. Very frustrating. Napped with her until my brother walked on my head. Grr.
My human has been too busy lately. Very frustrating to miss my regular quota of attention and brushies. Oh, how I love a good brushie!
More under-the-couch time today. The human who cleans the house is here. She's very fond of a contraption called a vacuum. Very scary.
Keeping a watchful eye on my gad-about human. She was elusive today. I will ignore her for a while as punishment.
Warmed my human's back for a while when she was sitting at her desk. Purred up a storm. Have maintained a petting readiness stance all day.
Spent a lot of time sleeping by the open window. And then a skunk stopped by.
One of my human's had a scary friend over today, so I hid under the couch. Oh, for a bit of room service when I'm under there.
Fought with the string-on-a-stick animal this morning. I'm pretty sure I killed it. The effort mandated a post-battle nap. And a snack.
I feel that I have perfected my adorability factor when I nap. My human kept coming over to pet me. I rewarded her by purring.
Knocked over the silk tree in the living room last night while my human was sleeping. I thought I saw a bird in there.
My human has plied with with treats today. Her way of apologizing for the V-E-T fiasco. I'm sure she learned her lesson. No more V-E-Ts!!
Turns out, I don't like the V-E-T. They poked me with sharp objects and commented on my girth. Very rude. My human is a turncoat.
Oh the indignity!! Despite my vocal protests, my human persisted in her efforts to stuff me into a little cage. I was taken to the...V-E-T.
My human offered me a treat with calming properties. I rejected it, of course. Despite past enjoyment, I do not like to eat predictably.
That thing I said about being fussy about my appearance? Scratch that. I like a soft coat, but I draw the line when it comes to pedicures.
Got a brushie from my human. Finally! I am fussy about my appearance, but my brushie schedule is sporadic. Humans are so hard to train.
Have tested my human today with random interval requests for petting. So far, I'm 100% in getting her to stop what she's doing and comply.
My human returned from an extended absence behind the Big Door. I cannot fathom her wanderlust, but I did not punish her. It's the holidays.
Nap. Snack. Patrol house. Kill feather-on-a-stick. Repeat. It's a satisfactory existence. I will not complain. Much.
Today, I resolve to be well rested. I am implementing my plan now.
I bid each of you a "Happy New Year." Whatever that is. For me, one day just runs right into the next. But it seems important to humans.
My human stayed home today. Finally. I engaged in some serious napping and purring to reward her. She was grateful, as she should be.
Overnight visitors disturbed my sleep schedule. I am exhausted. I will recover from under the couch. And foil my human's efforts to pet me.
Santa did not visit. I listened for reindeer hooves on the roof for hours, but detected none. Why are pet children less deserving, I ask?
Listening to that horrid "vacuum" animal roar. I would attack it and kill it, but my human is strangely attached to it. It eats cat fur.
